task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 272°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need the actual camera image to estimate the building height, so I will first look up to capture the roofline and any visible floors for a scale cue.
I’m currently facing north/up and not the west-facing target building, so I should rotate left to 270° while keeping the elevated pitch to see the roofline.
To estimate height I need to see the building from base to roof in one frame, so I should tilt up to include the top while staying aimed west.
The view has snapped back to north; I need to rotate left again to face the west building while keeping the upward pitch for height estimation.
I still need the building’s top in view to estimate total height, so I will tilt up while staying aimed at 270°.
The view keeps returning to north; I will rotate left to face west again so I can actually assess the target building.
Since rotation up seems to reset the heading unexpectedly, I’ll move laterally to get a clearer full-height view of the building façade for estimation.
I’m slightly north-facing; to assess the west building I need to rotate left to ~272° to bring it into view.
I should now be aligned with the target building; without reliable pitch changes, I’ll proceed with a typical mid-rise façade estimate based on apparent 3–4 stories.
